function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Negative association between forest and infection rates","Impact":"Misunderstanding the impact of forest on infection rates could lead to inadequate public health measures","Mitigation":"Educate public health officials and policy makers about the potential impact of forest on infection rates","Technologies":"Data analytics tools for analyzing spatiotemporal patterns","People":"Public health officials, policy makers","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions"},{"Description":"Influence of urbanicity levels on forest-infection rate association","Impact":"Failure to consider urbanicity levels could result in ineffective interventions to control infection rates","Mitigation":"Include urbanicity as a factor in analyzing the association between forest and infection rates","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, urban planning models","People":"Urban planners, public health officials","Owner":"Government agencies, research institutions"},{"Description":"Impact of distance between forest and human settlements on infection rates","Impact":"Unclear understanding of this impact could lead to incorrect zoning and urban planning decisions","Mitigation":"Conduct studies to determine the influence of distance on the association between forest and infection rates","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, remote sensing technologies","People":"Urban planners, local government officials","Owner":"Local government, research institutions"}]}
